content.description:
Start up the main gully splitting the north face of Steep Peak, but veer climber's right at 1600' to follow a steeper ice band. Gain a lightly treed ridge and climb over three rock steps to access the easier snow slops right under the ridge. Some spicy rock moves will require a belay.

Same start as Whatever's Clever, veering right at the second rock band.
None - a light alpine rack is recommended.

The main gully on the north face of Steep Peak. Go up the wide scree basin to to upper sections of the couloir, and ascend up to 65 degrees ice and 70 degrees snow to a sub-summit of Steep Peak. From there, walk up to the summit or descend following the west ridge back to Darkside lake. In summer or early season, three (potentially more) slabs will bar the way after the NW bend at 1800ft.

This route is skiiable (apparently!) but I can't find anything about a mixed ascent anywhere - only trace of activity was a two-pins anchor someone rapped off a while ago, judging by rust. Creating on here, do comment if you know who got on top of it first.

Start at Darkside lake, the route is shown in photos attached
None - rock takes pins and nuts  easily and an alpine ice rack is recommended.
A popular backcountry skiing area, encircled by Peak 2318 and the informally named Steep Peak. Access is easy and short from Duffey Lake Road.
